Reviews.Title: “Very Handy for Town”
Reviews.Author: Barry C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is idealy suited for anyone who wants to visit the Greenwich Area. It is large well appointed building rooms are large staff extremely helpful. We booked a family suite ie 1 double and three singles in seperate rooms with one on suite. The rooms were fine but the central heating was very noisy during the night , switched on or off. Breakfast was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A great escape from the heart of London”
Reviews.Author: Ted A
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel located outside the noise and bustle of London city but within easy reach (20 minutes) by train. The station is only 5 minutes walk away in Blackheath village and trains run in both directions every 15 minutes; we were told that the last train back was about 12.30am (but do check!). The hotel room was clean and comfortable. The bed and bedding was ultra-comfortable and the room at the back of the hotel was very quiet (until the dawn chorus!). My only disapointment was the very tiny old fashioned telly, a larger flat screen would have been nice, and in common with many hotels really mean with the tea bags (2) and coffees (2) and no night time drinks - come on, they only cost fractions of a penny! Didn’t have a meal there but the breakfast was very good, great choice and excellent tea and coffee service. An excellent location for quiet walks across the heath and down into Greenwich park and the observatory etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not like a chain hotel....Which isn't a bad thing.”
Reviews.Author: AndrewL14
Reviews.Content: This hotel enjoys a great position looking out over the windswept - seriously - Blackheath. I have stayed here twice now, both times in February, the first time in 2011 and again in 2012. During the most recent stay there were a number of coach parties in residence resulting in some serious congestion at Breakfast on one morning despite the discrete warning notice posted at reception suggesting that guests get there early on a Sunday(!) due to the place being busy. Although there is free car parking as others have commented, don't rely on it. If you arrive late, I would guess that is after about 4PM on some days, you won't get in either at the front or back. There is free road side parking nearby but watch the signs carefully to see what time you need to be clear in the morning. The bar is a little quirky and if you are fond of late night drinking might be a dissapointment. There is a bar service of sorts from the night porter, but the selection was rather limited. Despite all of this I like this hotel, and the Blackheath Village has enough pubs and restaurants to keep the interest up.

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: happystaying
Reviews.Content: This hotel was chosen because of the location. It was near to mainline railway station which got me to central London in 20 minutes, and going the other way to Woolwich in 10 minutes. It was a bonus to find the rooms as well maintained as the website pictures. The real bonus however was to find that not only did the hotel have free parking and looked out onto the big open space of Blackheath, just 2 minutes walk away was Blackheath village. A real village with numerous shops, cafes and restaurants. Staff were friendly and helpful and we were impressed by the quality of the dinning room. Just one tip. The rooms on the front of the hotel enjoy a great view across the heath, but do suffer from traffic noise. Our tip is to ask for a room looking over the garden at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Friendly and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Menomex
Reviews.Content: I spent two nights in the Clarendon hotel with my family and I have to say it was really lovely. The rooms are comfortable and housekeeping staff are spot on! Breakfast was good with lots to chose from and the dinner menu is very reasonable. Reception staff are really friendly and very helpful. All in all a really nice place to stay and really good rail and other transport to near the hotel. I would definitely go back as would my other two family members.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Tired”
Reviews.Author: longhair9
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Clarendon was very pleasant although I thought the hotel looked and felt a little tired. The corridors upstairs were very narrow and not unlike a hostel in some ways. The room was quite spacious but the en-suite was very cramped, good shower (which took up much of the space) but using the basin for washing was hard work. It was however clean and the food was good, staff friendly but seemed a little reserved. I had a room at the front of the hotel with good views over the heath but the traffic noise whilst not deafening was always present. Excellent position from a tourist point of view easy walking access to Greenwich and all its attractions and Blackheath itself was a charming place. I have stayed in better and on the other hand I have stayed in much worse, it is what it is but would benefit from a lot of TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: timeismore
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here yearly for many years when working at Excel and the staff dont change! it is remakable in this day and age to see the same smiling faces and welcome from everyone. Nothing is too much trouble. This isnt the most modern glitzy, minimalist style hotel - but it is traditional and friendly. Big soft duvets!! Food first rate. Village faclities and lovely surroundings. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Fluffybabe
Reviews.Content: Paid only £135 for a quad room on new years eve, which included ticket for bus to o2 arena and a lovely English breakfast. Room was very clean but beds a little hard with hard pillows! So take your own for comfort! The staff were very polite and helpful. A bargain for location and walking distance to a lovely shopping/eating area. Would defiantly stay here again. Close to bus stop too.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Santa”
Reviews.Author: Xstar
Reviews.Content: Really nice Christmas lunch at the Clarendon. Food really good and the atmosphere excellent with very friendly staff and the whole experience effortless (unlike if we'd stayed at home :-)). Thanks Santa for the prezzie and particularly the smooth jazz pianist. I've not stayed at this hotel but have encouraged international visitors London to stay here for short visits and they always have a great time as it's so convenient for the delights of Blackheath and Greenwich (walk over the heath and through the park) as well as the short overground ride to London Bridge/Charing X.

Reviews.Title: “Basic English style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Josepherely
Reviews.Content: You could be dropped from a space ship into an English hotel and know you were there from the style of the carpet through to the way the bath works. This was pretty much typical of a mass market hotel. Room was clean and sheets were starched, bathroom on the small side, room not large, just big enough. Fine for a short stay or overnighter Breakfast was the typical English style with scrambled eggs of a rubber consistency (this is an English thing and the same everywhere except in top hotels) and the obligatory baked beans (sorry can't do that in the morning). One guest had a mixture of baked beans and fruit! Reception was efficient and fine. Bathroom worked (water hot and pressure fine). Like most hotels in this category has the liquid soap dispensers so bring your own toiletries if you want something decent.

Reviews.Title: “It serves its purpose very well.”
Reviews.Author: mightybighands
Reviews.Content: I stayed here whilst attending a dinner in Greenwich. The location is excellent for Greenwich, Exel and O2 and, probably, several other places as well. Free car parking (but limited spaces) and easy access to A2/M2/A102/M25 and very easy to find. However I doubt it would be much use to visitors to central London. Rooms are functional and clean. Comfortable. Breakfast was an unexpected bonus ~ a comprehensive hot buffet and limitless toast etc. Staff were courteous and helpful. If I need to visit the area and stay over I wouldn't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: syates
Reviews.Content: We (a group of 4 female friends) stayed here for 2 nights, in 2 twin bedded rooms, whilst visiting the O2 arena for the ATP tennis. Our rooms were on the first floor over looking the car park at the back of the hotel. The bathroom had a shower over the bath, with plenty of hot water. The beds are made up with sheets and blankets....It would be good to have duvets. The room was clean, and perfectly adequate for 2 nights. On arrival and indeed at all times the staff were friendly, polite and helpful. Breakfast was included in the rate, and this was indeed excellent. A full English, cereals, fruit, toast, cold meat and cheese, porridge , yogurt, choice of tea or coffee, so a great choice. The full english was hot and well presented ( all self service) and the eggs were perfect! The dinning area was busy, but was very well organised. The bus stop is right outside to get to the O2, and the main line station back to London Bridge is approx. 5 mins walk down the hill. There are plenty of good restaurants and coffee shops in Blackheath. Would recommend, especially if visiting the O2, and indeed good value for money for London hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the O2”
Reviews.Author: NIRS3
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel as it is only 15 mins on a direct bus (108) to the O2 where we were watching the ATP Tennis Masters Finals, We stayed two nights and found the hotel to be slightly above average. The rooms were on the small side and we had to move to a second room after our bathroom floor became flooded after using the toilet. This was done without any fuss and a porter came with the new room key and assisted our transfer.The hotel seems to be in the process of some redecoration and our second room smelt of gloss paint. Annoyingly the radiator valve could not be switched off which meant we had to suffer an annoying wooshing noise of the water flowing through it. We were so tired after a full day at the O2 that it did not really bother us. The breakfast was a little above average with the food being replaced promptly and not having that steamed look that you often see. There was a good choice and you could order poached eggs, kippers, smoked haddock etc . The latter was served with two poached eggs and was lovely. The toast machine caused much amusement but the staff were willing to get your toast for you if you felt overawed at having to make your own. Beds were comfortable and bulk soap.shampoo and hand lotion were provided in the bathroom. Usual tea and coffee plus a little biscuit and a more than adequate hairdryer was provided. The TV was awful 15 inch and very old and the channels froze so it could not really be used. As is common with many hotels of this type it provides accommodation for coach parties. There were a party of Germans staying the first night so breakfast was very busy and it was a little noisy at night but everything was much quieter on the second night/day. The bar was fine and for London the prices were very reasonable.(£3.35 for a pint compared to £4.50 at the O2) we met friends for dinner so did not use the restaurant facilities although the prices looked a little on the high side. A good variety of items were available for room service. It is ideal for the O2 as the buses run all night and Blackheath has plenty of eating places. Avoid the fish and chip shop opposite the staion as on a previious visit we were charged over £20 for two fish and chips. When I questioned this I was told "This is Blackheath sir - everything is expensive here!" The hotel has a great location overlooking the heath and is well placed to get to London in about 25 mins or 15 mins to Greenwich in the other direction. I felt the hotel had really friendly staff and great potential but is a little tired and needs smartening up and modernising. Would stay again as it is really convenient but at the reduced price of £99 a room it is getting near the top end of what I am prepared to pay for this standard.

Reviews.Title: “"Computer Says no"”
Reviews.Author: Peter S
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. We booked a room here and I specifically reuqested a heath view room and had a very specific conversation with the person I booked with on this very subject. I was told there was no recollection of this when I arrived to check in. I can live with mistakes but not the attitude that followed. As luck would have it I managed to get my wife and I a room at OnesixTwo just up the road. It was cheaper, better decorated, lovely comfy beds, and service that was becoming an established that would be described as a service industry. My father has been head doorman of the Goring (royal wedding venue for the Middletons) Hotel in London for 45 years and when I told him what had happened at the Clarendon he was shocked. To give the review some balance I will say that the location is fantastic but then I suppose the current team are unlikely to have had any bearing on this positive note.

Reviews.Title: “Another review - one year on”
Reviews.Author: Milk_Milk_Lemonade
Reviews.Content: About a year ago I wrote a review of the Clarendon based on my first visit. I've been back quite regularly over the last year and I was about to provide a very much better review, but....... Good points - Location - My previous review mentioned a problem with a bar meal. I haven't eaten an evening meal in the Clarendon since then as there are loads of alternative bars and restaurants in walking distance. It's also walking distance from Blackheath Station so it's 25 minutes from Central London. Parking - free car parks on site. They may be full but on street parking is safe and you only need to pay between 9am and 7pm so if coming in after work there's a maximum of an hour to pay and you'll be off in the morning before the charges kick in. Bar prices - £3.35 for a pint in a 3 star London hotel is not bad at all. Not so good points - Room prices - For most of this year I've paid £79 per night. In January/February this was reduced to £69. At these prices the Clarendon was excellent value. Who cares if the decor is a bit tatty if all you want is a comfortable bed for the night and a reasonable breakfast? However, the price has just gone up to £109. At that price I will be looking elsewhere next time I'm in the area on business. If I find that everywhere else is the same price (getting ready to fleece tourists for the Olympics.....) or if I find that everywhere else is fully booked and I can only get in to the Clarendon I won't be too disappointed as the Clarendon is OK. It's now just rather expensive for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea.... meant to be a 'treat'... so I thought!!!!”
Reviews.Author: janeybaby472
Reviews.Content: Having just got back from an 'Afternoon Tea' Birthday Treat..... feel I have to write my first ever review.................!!! Well, I realise we didn't pay the going rate of between £20-£40 of a top London Hotel, ie The Ritz, The Savoy etc but at just short of £13pp, would have preferred to have got a M&S sandwich for a fraction of the price!!! ... and a whole lot tastier!!! Ok... lets begin....Reception, bland, Decor, even blander, Restaurant, entirely empty except for a lovely OAP and I presume her daughter, who might have nostalgic memories....!!?? Food - Three dry finger sandwiches on a 3 tiered cake stand, along with a couple of dry currant scones that would have tasted better being made by my pet dog, two disgusting looking cakes (when asked if they were bought in, waiter readily replied 'yes'... think he felt ashamed)!!! And... decorated with mushy strawberries..... an absolute disgrace... they should be ashamed of themselves!!!!!!!!! This should be a sweet treat!!!!?? Right?? And I did complain... all we got was a glass of fizzy stuff that tasted like cheap 'pop'....Pay the extra and go where we know it is good.... After all.... its the little luxuries that we love and are worth paying for.........

Reviews.Title: “nice staff, good food, shame about the beds”
Reviews.Author: DamLou
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights October 2011. Staff all friendly. No wi-fi available during my stay (some reason given being T mobile hot spot not working). Evening meal (3 times) in restaurant surprisingly good, (lamb shank was absolutely as good as any I've ever had!) and breakfast was a good buffet selection. Downside was it had on one day a large European touring party in and therefore was busier, and the orange juice was clearly rather diluted that day!. Slightly noisy rooms, noise from corridor and outside, with warnings on doors about risk of break in, and "not to leave anything valuable in your room". Bathroom very small but adequate. Bed was saggy, very saggy in fact, and smelt really fusty and sweaty as if the bedspread and blankets (that's right, no duvet here) and pillows had never ever been washed. Would i stay here again?, possibly, but I'd check out other options first.

Reviews.Title: “Only worth staying for the location”
Reviews.Author: Greyvanman
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at this hotel on a regular basis over an extended period of a few months I feel as though I can give this place an objective review. . . . The rooms are comfortable, but very tired. All rooms suffer from a lack of investment and have tiny, wall mounted TVs that are clinging on to an old analogue broadcast system that will eventually be turned off in 2012. I have never seen such a poor TV in a hotel room, EVER! When I'm away from home on business I am not interested in other hotel facilities (bar, restaurant, etc.); I just want a good TV - please. Remote controls are unreliable and the channel programming is all over the place. The main decor is 1980s chic, with some recent investment in the bathrooms. This is completely immaterial if you can't have a shower on the 3rd floor due to there being no hot water (power shower, anyone?). If I fold myself in half I can just fit in the bath . . . . When you stay here you will be in one of three distinct groups: Young foreign students on a coach trip, a one-night O2 stopover or, like me, a van-driving worker. The car parking is a complete farce. A free-for-all where being double-parked (more of a problem in the rear car park) is just a mere inconveniance to those commiting the offence. Be ready to take down the offending car's no. plate and march into reception to rouse the lazy driver out of their slumber. There is another car park in the front of the hotel, but the loacations of some old bollards, and the problem of some of the staff using this car park as well, means that you will be looking for a parking place somewhere else. Breakfast is a tired farce; a greeter assigns you to a table and someone (eventually) asks you weather you want Tea or Coffee. The cereals never change (Crunchy Nut Corn Flakes, anyone?), the orange juice may or may not be watered down and I have given up on the cheapest-ingrediants-in-London cooked breakfast. Most of the work at breakfast is done by two middle-aged italians with other younger members of staff standing around and looking important (trying to avoid any work for as long as possible). This hotel, in summary, makes staying at a PremierInn / Travelodge something to look forward to. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and friendly”
Reviews.Author: jinman72
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night in order to see a concert at the nearby 02 Arena. Must say, the hotel is very handy with direct frequent bus services from close by (less than 5 minutes walk) to the O2 Arena main entrance, the return bus ticket was included in the price of the room. Breakfast next day was very good, plenty of choice and helpful friendly staff too. Would definitely stay again when going to the 02

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable pension-style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lisa222_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a week for a business trip attending a conference at the University of Greenwich. I found the hotel comfortable and the staff very kind. Originally the hotel was booked for the last two days of my stay, but the receptionist managed to find a room for me unexpectedly so that I would not have to switch hotel. What a relief ! I had a large room with all the comfort and very clean. The location, across from Greenwich Park is very pleasant for visitors wanting to walk or jog during their stay. The Village is conveniently located about 15-20 minutes from the Center of London by train, and had many boutiques and restaurants to enjoy a pleasant stay. The price of the hotel is very reasonable for the quality. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a London stay, in particular for a longer stay because of the pension-style of the hotel. There is a garden where to eat and have breakfast in the morning in the summer. All in all, I enjoyed the old world charm of the hotel for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK, just a bit tired....”
Reviews.Author: Simon99Crewe
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay in London at a reasonable price, and don't mind a room that needs an update, the Clarendon is OK. I've stayed here quite a few times, and the best rooms are not at the front as they suffer from traffic noise almost all night - rooms overlooking the garden are quietest. On this occasion my room was very small (which was a surprise as they're usually large). The bathroom had been updated (which was good) but still looked old-fashioned. Parking is very difficult, although free if you can find a space. Breakfast is good. Blackheath itself is a great place if you want good pubs and restaurants, and they're all in walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: xMissB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the night & we stayed in a tripple room.. was a nice size room! Clean & tidy, had a nice breakfast 2, would recommend! Would defo stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “THANKS HOUSE KEEPERS”
Reviews.Author: padkiv
Reviews.Content: I had a very comfortable stay in this hotel, great location. I was well received at the reception, my room was clean but needed some attention, old decor but tidy. The hotel put on an early breakfast for a number of us who had a very early start next day. As a result I rushed off and left behind a diary, reading glasses and a book. The house keepers were fantastic, they returned them to my home at no additional cost, well done Edna and team.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel and food excellent”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeSling077
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends and it was ideal as its a short bus ride to the O2. The bus stop is right outside of the hotel. Blackheath village is very nice. Restaurant staff are very friendly. The food was excellent and good value. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Busy place in urban well-serviced backwater Blackheath Village”
Reviews.Author: RiodeJaneiroWanderer
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a hearty walk across the bland, featureless Blackheath common - infamous as a mega burial pit for the Black Death and murder of Wat Tyler in the Peasant's Revolt in the 14th century. Hotel as parking so a good stop off point for visitors coming from the direction of Canterbury and France via the A2 and is easy to find. Blackheath station is down a steepish hill in a 7 minute walk. Trains go frequently to London Bridge, Charing X (Trafalgar Sq) and Cannon St (City) and less often to Victoria. Being in SE London, the hotel is relatively close to Canary Wharf and the Olympic site via Lewisham and DLR. Hotel is designed for large groups. I was expecting coach trips after reading reviews but there were none. Instead lots of specialist construction workers from England's provinces for the olympic project lined up for early - good simple breakfasts. Room was clean and basic - no free internet access. TV channels were very poor in choice and radio limited to awful Radio 1 and some independent rap-type station. At least Radio 4 should have been available. At around £85 a night this is not good value - but good value in London is a niche no hoteliers have sought to exploit, very sadly. That's why most people stay with friends when there. Clarendon is higgly-piggly with many complicated stairways. I discovered only after 2 days that there was a more direct route from my room to the breakfast room and reception - despite using the orientation of staff (they didn't seem to know their way around) Blackheath has lots of restaurants and pubs to cater for hotel visitors at a better price and quality. Hotel restaurant and bar food was edible but had no character - super-bland even before pulled straight from the freezer. Some guests send under-thawed food back. So head out to Giraffes or other places nearby. Staying in London hotels is a necessity more than a choice and Clarendon represents value in this context. I would recommend foreign visitors to stay further out of the city in a homely town and commute in. Within 30 minutes train journey of London there are many picturesque quality places to stay with much much better value and less alienating experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, staff a little abrupt, rooms very dated”
Reviews.Author: Tourman2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at end of August 2011 with a coach group. The reception was efficient booking the guests in but could have been quicker as had to sign registration cards first before and rooms were allocated slowing the whole process. Some rooms also were up and down stairs along winding corridors which disoriented some of the group. The location is wonderful overlooking the common with wide open spaces , but you are not in central London and the journey takes at least 30-45minutes if traffic is kind. The rooms are adequate but like others comment could do with some TLC as very dated and in need of improvement. Bed comfort acceptable, rooms of reasonable size, and functional Many of the group had bar meals- utter confusion over the ordering and subsequent serving, people being asked several time if they had ordered such and such.... no organisation comes to mind. The meals were OK but only that not the best especially when there are a couple of pubs, cafes nearby which could attract the trade away quiet easily... Breakfast again was sufficient the group all ate well no issues, though not sure if this was the norm as the film crew and coach staff of the TV series Coach Trip were at that hotel and it may have been show? Location gets it though and would stay again if rooms a little updated. Had the overall feel of an old Seaside type hotel once very grand but a shadow of its former self...

Reviews.Title: “Members of staff very unhelpful and rude”
Reviews.Author: nash j
Reviews.Content: clean room. No warmth from reception when you arrive. Reception staff looked bored and miserable. Resturant staff need to be clear what they are telling you about the menu. Breakfast waiter was so rude.Never going back there,

Reviews.Title: “Noisy shabby room but good food”
Reviews.Author: flibbit
Reviews.Content: Unlike other reviews on this site, I found the hotel staff to be very pleasant and helpful. The reception staff were friendly and smiling, the restaurant staff also helpful despite being very busy. I had dinner in the bar, which was reasonable value for a London hotel, and the breakfast buffet was well stocked and had everything you could need. Unfortunately what let the hotel down was the room. The furnishings were old and a bit shabby, but I could have lived with that as everything was spotlessly clean. However, my room was at the front of the hotel and was very noisy. Firstly, there was traffic noise from the busy road. Added to that was noise from other hotel guests standing outside the hotel entrance (maybe it was the smoking area?). I could hear every word of every conversation, and this constant flow of yapping people went on late into the night. When I mentioned this the next morning I was told rooms at the back of the hotel tend to be quieter. I was only staying the one night so this did not really help me, but might help other guests who read this review.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you value peace and quiet”
Reviews.Author: SAMLEE50
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night with my mum for a concert at 02. Beautiful location overlooking the Heath and Church and being very close to the shops and cafe's nearby which made for a lovely stroll. The food here was lovely but unfortunately the hotel itself let us down badly. Our room was dated, plain and dirty. It was also right over the car park and near the hotel bar. After midnight all we could hear were drunks shouting in the car park and screaming and leering outside the bar. I called down to reception at gone 1.00am and the receptionist apologised and said he would move them on. It was quiet for 10 minutes and then the noise started again. I called reception again and this time spoke to a monosyllabic man who called me a liar and said that the noise was no longer on. It turned out this man was the security guard at the hotel. I told him in no uncertain terms it WAS still on and to tell them to shut up. This man was rude with an attitude problem and made me feel quite intimidated. The noise carried on until 4.30am. I called reception again and was told that I would have to complain in the morning and they just pretended it wasn't happening. The service here is non existant. All this hotel cared about was placating the drunken wedding reception guests and all other guests just had to put up with it. My mum and I decided in the morning that we didn't want another slanging match with reception to ruin our day and so we let it drop. But I would like to help others who value a peaceful night please please avoid this hotel and shame on you Claremont for the way you treat your respectable paying customers.

Reviews.Title: “A shabby hotel with the rudest staff on the planet. I would not pay half the price to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Outsidethebox
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at this hotel again. The staff were the rudest I have ever encountered and the hotel is very shabby. The breakfast chef, (or man standing behind the breakfast counter wearing a chef's hat), was the rudest of all. When I asked for a poached egg (as a waiter had served me one from behind the counter on the previous morning), the chef just stood there looking at me, and when I asked "Is it self service this morning?", he sneered, "Well that IS the whole idea". The manager at the breakfast dining room was quite efficient and friendly, but one morning when she was not there, we waited fifteen minutes for a high chair. When my husband asked a waitress if she could find one as we'd been waiting fifteen minutes, she bayed "I'm only trying to find out if you want tea or coffee" and walked off. At breakfast I ordered decaf coffe and was served a pot of hot water and a few sachets of instant coffee. I would expect more froma three star hotel, where I was paying £130 per night. The reception staff were brusque and unwelcoming. The decor in the hotel is very shabby. Our room was adequate, the bed clothes had seen better days - the brown pilled blanket was worn almost to a thread and there was a stain on the carpet, but overall the room was clean enough. The only good point about this hotel is its location in Blackheath, but in the future I will be looking for other accommodation in the village with less rude staff. Really, don't stay here - you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Geat settings and views.”
Reviews.Author: trangwales
Reviews.Content: The rooms are looking a little tired, but the service was excellent and a problem quickly solved. Menu choice and service was good

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: lynnderby
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Clarendon and was pleasantly surprised. The room was small, but was clean and well decorated. The bathroom was recently refurbished and spotless. The staff were very nice and helpful, except for the man on the night shift who was rather grumpy.Breakfast was fresh and well presented and the staff very pleasant. Wehad a good stay at a great price...would stay there again, but would request a room on the back as the hotel is on a busy road.

Reviews.Title: “The way we were”
Reviews.Author: Bedouinboy
Reviews.Content: I rather enjoyed staying at this hotel. It had an almost colonial touch to it, with a lovely restaurant and clean white – starched – table cloths and napkins and exotic young gentlemen waiters that only added to the colonial atmosphere – as I saw it. What is more they were charming and polite too, which is quiet unusual to find in the UK these days. In fact the restaurant is one of the highlights of this hotel. The menu was perfect and it was a pleasure to have everything so perfectly presented and of excellent quality. I loved to have the breakfast with poached haddock and a poached egg! I also liked the excellent room service and afternoon tea, and if I was running late they brought me a continental breakfast to my room. The hotel is situated overlooking the heath and I passed many an hour just sitting at my window admiring the view and watching the Englishman and his dog. I also took walks across the heath to Greenwich Park; so vast and beautiful, with flower beds and a duck pond – and squirrels everywhere. I even went as far down into Greenwich and took a boat ride up the Thames. So, the position of the hotel could not be better. Blackheath village, just a short walk away, is very nice and has plenty of very good coffee houses. Also Blackheath Train Station, where I took the train to Luton Airport which turned out to be quicker than taking a taxi! (And cheaper, needless to say). The staff were very cordial at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Clarendon Hotel, Blackheath”
Reviews.Author: mainswiring
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Clarendon for two nights and chose it for its proximity to the O2 Arena. Public transport links were easy from central London - a short journey fro Charing Cross station and a 5-minute walk from the railway station at Blackheath. The room was clean and the breakfast excellent. Bus links to the O2 were also very easy. The only minor issue was a slightly noisy heating system which kept my partner awake during the night. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this hotel. Also ideally positioned for exploring Greenwich. Blackheath itself is also a nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Had a perfect Wedding here”
Reviews.Author: MrsHigginsPage
Reviews.Content: On the 7th of May this year I had my wedding meal in the Meridian Suite and the reception in the Westcombe suite at Clarendon Hotel. One word can only describe my day 'Perfect'! The staff did a fantastic job setting up the rooms and they looked fantastic, Georgina who was in charge of my big day did a great job in making sure everything looked fab and run smoothly. Having my meal and reception here was perfect, the hotel has 2 car parks so my 50 guests who attended my meal had no problems and the evening guests were able to park anywhere in Blackheath as it's free after 7pm. The food was beautiful, we had the carvery and it was by far the best ive ever had and alot of my guests agreed. The meats were cook perfectly, the starters and dessert were both great too. All the staff were very friendly and made everything extra special for us. The evening food again was great and the sea food got a big thumbs up from all my guests! We stayed in the honeymoon suite and it was lovely, we got chocolates, champagne, fresh fruit bowl and flowers!! The hotel is in a great area too. Blackheath village is perfect for a walk about & some lunch and you have Greenwich park just across the common too. Im so glad we picked The Clarendon hotel as our venue!

Reviews.Title: “small room”
Reviews.Author: plotter123
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks nice from the outside, the inside is very dated, the room my wife and i stayed in was so small you could not open the door without hitting the bed,Blackheath is a very nice area, but the unpleasant room and bed means i wont stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: SugarMouse
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my mother - we chose the hotel for its proximity to the O2 arena as we were going there to see a concert. The location was good for this as the hotel is within walking distance of a tube station and a bus stop to travel to the O2. However despite outward appearances the hotel is overpriced and the rooms, although clean, were too hot, with no air conditioning, noisy at night, as we had to open the window due to the heat and were overlooking a main road, and uncomfortable - the beds were springy and lumpy. The attached bathroom had a bath with no attached shower - some people might find it difficult to wash their hair without some kind of shower attachment. The bath was also fixed into the wall so if you wanted to grab hold of both sides of the bath to get out of it it wasn't possible, as you could only rest your hand on one side. This made it awkward to get out of the bath and wouldn't be appropriate for anyone elderly or infirm. But the worst thing was having no hot water, which we only discovered in the morning when we went to have a wash. It had been slightly warmer than cold the night before and we had thought it might be alright once the tap had been running for a while. But it didn't get any warmer. We had to boil the kettle and pour water from that into the bath and basin to have a wash. I politely explained to the receptionist when we checked out that there was no hot water and they would want to make sure it was hot for the next guests in that room, and she just glared at me and said "You should have called us." When I started to explain that we didn't have the chance as we only realised in the morning when about to have a wash before breakfast, and we didn't have time to wait around that morning for the problem to be fixed, she walked off after just a few words. Just a simple 'I'm really sorry about that' would have been nice but we had no apology at all, she just didn't want to know. The last thing worth mentioning is the breakfast. We went down to breakfast about halfway through the time given and just managed to get a table before the queues built up - when we left the breakfast room there were about thirty people waiting for a table, many of whom had been there for quite a long time. We saw a notice saying the breakfast time had been extended by half an hour for that morning. It was really busy in the breakfast room, the staff were rushed off their feet. A menu on the table said that staff would serve hot drinks and toast at the table but we weren't offered any of this. The buffet selection was decent and there was a reasonable range of hot and cold food to choose from, with plenty for vegetarians as well as meat-eaters. And we did manage to get some toast and hot drinks eventually when someone came to clear our plates away. But it was a little bit late then. I felt sorry for the staff as there weren't enough of them to deal with all of the customers. To sum up I'd say the hotel is in a good location for the O2 so I'd recommend it for that, if you just want a safe roof over your head for a night after a concert. But don't expect to get much sleep or to have hot water to wash with!

Reviews.Title: “Oldie but a Goodie”
Reviews.Author: mkoczyk
Reviews.Content: A very charming hotel located in Blackheath Village. Lots of quaint little shops to visit as well as a large open park in front of the hotel to run around in. The buffet breakfast had enough selections to keep you from being hungry the better part of the day. The wait staff was extremely friendly, and professional. Since it is an older hotel, the bathrooms are a bit dated. The suite that we stayed at had the smallest sink I have ever encountered. However, it did have a tub with a shower head, and was spotless. The four poster bed was also a nice touch. In the evening walk over to the "Princess of Wales Pub" (located next to the hotel) and treat yourself to a pint or two. CHEERS !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! Perfect for the O2”
Reviews.Author: DonnaMarie1983
Reviews.Content: My friend had booked The Clarendon for myself and another friend for a 1 night stay after seeing Boyzone at the O2. While trying to book she found it hard to find a hotel with a room that had 3 single beds, so this hotel was chosen for that reason. The welcome was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and tidy, exactly what we wanted. All the staff were happy and made sure that you had everything you needed. Blackheath is a lovely area, you hardly feel like you are in London. The breakfast was as we expected, a wide choice of options, I can recommend the full english though. I would definalty return and definately recommend to any type or traveller

Reviews.Title: “Clean, excellent friendly staff, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: female1981
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on 3 separate occasions now. I am a solo, female traveller and was anxious to find somewhere where I felt comfortable, safe and relaxed. The Clarendon was a great find. It's price is comparable to some B+Bs in London and it is similar in price to Travelodges etc.... yet it is so much better. The main good points-: - Rooms are warm, a reasonable size, have tea and coffee facilities and beds firm but comfortable. Cleaned to a high standard daily. - The reception staff are very friendly - always smiling, efficient and helpful. I can also leave my laptop/valuables there when I go out for the day - The breakfast is great - cereal, porridge, toast, salami, cheese, yoghurt, fruit and a really yummy full English. Can also order other things, The breakfast room is often very busy but I have never waited for a seat and they never run out of things. Lots of staff to help - Blackheath is a lovely part of London - green, nice shops, cafes etc.... Much quieter than staying centrally but with really good access to the centre of London via train (no tube) taking 15-20 mins to London Bridge/Waterloo East etc... Trains run until late. The bad points - Rooms are variable - old (Georgian?) hotel. One room I had was next to the road which is busy and was therefore quite noisy when the commuter traffic started in the morning. One room was on the top floor so water pressure much less good and the bathroom was tiny. One room had a much smaller, older television than I had had previously and reception less good. However I never asked to move rooms and saw these "problems" as part of being in an older style hotel and not anything that made my stay in anyway unpleasant. I have given this hotel 5/5. I have stayed at 5 star London hotels such as the Landmark and the Waldorf previously - obviously the Clarendon is not in that league BUT it is good value and a pleasant stay. It might not be the best place for a really special occasion or a romantic weekend away but for a holiday to the capital, a weekend away with friends or even for business, I think it is a really excellent choice. I have already booked for another 2 weeks for future visits to London.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, this hotel has really improved”
Reviews.Author: tokcox01
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Clarendon on a number of occasions over the last 10 years, and it has really improved. The first time I was excellent, but then it started to decline, but it appears there has been some recent investment and improvement to the rooms with an increase in the quality. As always the staff are excellent, professional and extremely friendly, this is the one constant about the Clarendon. We stayed in one of the family suites, which was excellent, spacious 2 rooms, though the bathroom, was a bit small. The only negative comments from the teenages were that the choice of TV channels was very limited, didn't bother me or my partner, but teenagers notice these shortcomings, and that they would have preferred duvets to the bedding provided. Parking is restrictive, but this is not the hotels fault, due to its location, but we were lucky and managed to get a spot. The food in the hotel is excellent and very good value, even the children found things that they liked. The location for the lovely borough of Greenwich with its many attractions is excellent, and everything of interest is in walking distance. Also is is close to Blackheath train station and you can be in central London in about 15 to 20 minutes. Overall we really liked the Clarendon, and will definitely be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing was too much trouble for the staff!”
Reviews.Author: happycustomer20
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Clarendon about twice a year for the last five years, to visit my mum who lives round the corner. The standard of service is consistently high, the staff always helpful and friendly. Though the location is great, and the tarrifs great value, for us it's the staff who really make the place!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Sunday Lunch - perfect for a relaxed family celebration.”
Reviews.Author: Melinda_Que_Linda
Reviews.Content: We've just celebrated a lovely family birthday at the hotel. We weren't residential guests, but booked for lunch in the afternoon. The food was wonderful- the carvery, vegetables and freshly made sauces and accompaniments. The range of starters and desserts was great too. The staff were professional and attentive, the main dining room was open, bright and ever so slightly grand- plus it over looked the lovely walled garden and gazebo. Very family friendly atmosphere - there were other families celebrating and others just out for a special treat. Tremendous value too. We've always gone else where in Blackheath for special occasions, but we'll definitely be back to the Clarendon. Thank you all for a quality experience.

Reviews.Title: “DSS residents, Poor Service, Dated rooms and bathrooms, High Price but good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Hicksonnator
Reviews.Content: I lived in Blackheath for many years and recently decided to stay at this hotel when travelling through London. I was very disappointed. This is a 3 star hotel (at most) at 4 or 5 star prices. I will stay in the Novotel Greenwich next time. When we arrived we had 6 bags. I asked for some help (which was met with apathy by the hotel reception staff). Someone did arrive who suggested he take one bag and we not use the lift. Having travelled for 19 hours I was pretty disappointed to not have even the most basic of hotel service. We also appeared to be one of the few residents that were paying. A large number of homeless or those on welfare appear to be staying at the hotel. There were screaming families in the reception and corridors (think dorm room). I was very nervous about leaving our posessions in our room. Rooms are fine, although there is some noise if you are facing the heath. Bathrooms are dated and could need some refreshing. Checkout is 10.30, which is ridiculous. Breakfast is great. Would highly recommend it. Blackheath is also a wonderful village. Had this hotel been 70 GBP per night I think it would have been fine. However, and the pricepoint of 99-120 per night I think their service and quality have priced them out of the market.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy traditional hotel, friendly staff - good for business stop”
Reviews.Author: safarigirl68
Reviews.Content: I arrived here very early in the morning having flown back from African overnight to go to a conference in docklands. The hotel were very accommodating about letting me have my room early in the morning and had arranged before hand with a colleague of mine for us to room share, in the event gave me a seperate room very quickly. The only downside about the hotel is that some of the older room (of which I was in one) were right up in the roof up lots of stairs and confusing to find, difficult too with a heavy suitcase! The room was in the eaves, very cosy but the sloping roof meant that the bath was a challenge to get in and out of (I'm quite tall!) and there was no shower which was a negative in the circumstances. The second morning the hotel had laid on coaches to docklands for the conference which was fabulous as I'd had difficulty getting to the hotel the day before, there being no tube station nearby. The nearest overground is Blackheath and as an infrequent user of the tube coming across town from Heathrow it involved many changes with heavy luggage and a walk to the hotel at the end which wasn't great, but that's not a critism of the hotel, I can't expect them to create their own tube stop! I didn't eat dinner in the hotel, but breakfast was good - nice selection of everything and staff efficient. Very good value for money for the room including B&B and the complimentary coach to Excel. I'd definitely book again for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: Claudette13
Reviews.Content: Horrible beds, the smell of food all night long, dirty bathroom, smelly bedlinnen, bad breakfast....... It's an old hotel and the price for a room is ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Quite noisy would benefit from soundproofing. Comfortable, clean & tidy room......bathroom basic but adequate.”
Reviews.Author: mummygreenbroom
Reviews.Content: Having read other review's wasen't quite sure what to expect. Our room had a lovely view over the Heath. The downside was that was above the front entrance and was quite noisy........especially from 'smokers' gathering outside and noise from the traffic. Would benefit from soundproofing. The room was clean and tidy and bed very comfortable. The bathroom although not modern was adequate - bath with over bath shower. Buffet style breakfast The Hotel is very handy for buses and train into London

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Milk_Milk_Lemonade
Reviews.Content: I was working in Greenwich and booked in to the Clarendon at £79 for b&b. Firstly, the good points. The bedroom was a good size, clean and with comfortable beds. Breakfast is from a buffet but some of the items weren't particularly warm, but there is in option to have things such as haddock freshly prepared. There was also tomato juice available which makes a pleasant change from "Orange juice and that's your lot". The not so good things - Wi-fi access is available but is expensive. If smaller B&Bs can provide free wi-fi access then why do bigger hotels feel the need to screw customers? The major problem though was with my evening meal. I ate in the lounge and ordered soup and a burger. Some brain dead idiot thought that both courses should be served to me at the same time! When soup appears on the menu under "Starters" and the burger is in the "Mains" section that should give a huge clue as to how and when they should be served. I didn't ask the waiter to take the burger back to keep it warm as I'm quite sure that anything going back to the kitchen would have been spat in (or worse) before being returned to me. (Both the soup and the burger were actually quite tasty - although the burger was slightly colder than I would have liked by the time that I ate it). If I am working in Greenwich again I'd go back to the Clarendon, but I'll order the evening meal one course at a time so that they can't make such a huge cock-up again.

Reviews.Title: “Try to avoid”
Reviews.Author: London5687
Reviews.Content: The rooms aren't that nice and neither is the hotel. We paid £120 to stay here and I thought that we should have spend £20 more and gone to a nice hotel. The breakfast in the hotel was about as good as it gets in a local cafe. I wouldn't want to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel with rude staff”
Reviews.Author: DGB007
Reviews.Content: Went there for a wedding which took place (reception) at the Clarendon. When booking I have asked for an early check in as the wedding was at 2pm and the normal check in time was also at 2pm. I got to the hotel at 11h30 to find out that the room was not ready. The receptionist was rude and ignorant. She eventually told me that it will be ready at 12h30. An hour later I came back and again the room wasn't ready and was told that it will not be ready untill 2pm....Great! How do you get ready for an occasion when you don't have a room, and access to a bathroom after I travelled??? I had to borrow the Groom parents room to get ready...can you beleive it? The room was terrible and the shower was the best as the cold water was stronger than the hot water... therefore you could only have a COLD shower.....The breakfast was terrible... I felt like eating in an old people's home...it was depressing. I complaint to the main Manager Ken [-] who refused to pay back some compensation after having dealt with some rude staff....so it is your choice to stay at this place but it is really NOT worth it.....They could do with a good Interior Designer and some staff training!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I've stayed in this year”
Reviews.Author: slowhandjack
Reviews.Content: I have nothing good to say about this hotel. Parking impossible. Staff unhelpful. On a roundabout. Room dated - with a 14 inch TV. No redeeming features. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Caution !”
Reviews.Author: PHB35
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers a trip in the England of the Fifties, which some elder citizens may like. The plumbing, decoration and (good) breakfast all come from this period. The noise on some evening events is more modern. And most important : do not think there will be a parking space available. Do not think that there are nearby free parking spaces. Do not think that you shall avoid a high fee... especially when the Borough website rejects your Visa Card (because you are a foreigner, without English postcode ?). So, OK for returning to the 50's, but not at this price !

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff, Car Vandalised”
Reviews.Author: CHARL13
Reviews.Content: Long story short, I had made a reservation for a date in August which I couldn't make. "No problem" I was told, we can change the reservation for a different date, "That's all done for you". I turn up on the rearranged date, to be told there is no reservation under my name, and that I hadn't turned up to the previous booking. I thought that explaining that I had phoned and rearranged the date would straighten things out. Oh no, Aiesha on reception repeatedly told me that I was a no show to the previous booking, no matter how many times I told her I had phoned to rearrange, and hadn't just turned up out of the blue expecting a room. It took the intervention of the shift manager to get a room sorted for us. Customer care courses would certainly be a benefit. That said, Anne-Marie was very helpful and pleasent. The hotels car parks are woefully inadequate for its size. I therefore had no choice but to park my car round the back of a church (as suggested by the hotel security guard) a few minutes walk from the hotel. I returned to it this morning to find it had been vandalised. The bedroom was ok, but the bathroom is in dire need of updating. I shant be back.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced and run down”
Reviews.Author: noredpen
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is in a great location, over-looking the heath, and has a lovely Georgian appearance, the rooms leave much to be desired. Our room was very small and somewhat drab, as well as very hot and airless. The sheets and pillow cases were clean, but the pillows smelt less than fresh. Breakfast was adequate, but hot food kept running out and there was a long wait for more. My cup was chipped, while my husband's tea-pot was cracked. Our second breakfast, in the splendid library, was a little better. Apart from the room maid, who had a good hunt for my lost earring, the staff were unfriendly, even off-hand. At £99 a night, we could have done better in a Premier Inn or a Travel Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the o2 arena”
Reviews.Author: giggs46
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i have stayed at this hotel a couple of times now. We picked this hotel as it is 10 mins bus ride to the O2 arena, which is what we needed it for. Our room is clean and basic, but fine for what we needed. Bathroom was also clean but needed updating. Breakfast is a buffet but still nice. Would recommend this hotel if you are going to the O2 arena and just want a place to get your head down for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Old and poor value”
Reviews.Author: woodynwoody
Reviews.Content: We have family in Blackheath and over the years have often thought about staying at the Clarendon. On a recent trip to England, we stayed 2 nights at the Clarendon, as we were in a bind for accommodation - what a disappointment! Although the Clarendon is fabulously situated, located on the heath and in a beautiful building - its appeal stops once you walk through the doors. There have been no up dates to this hotel, its old and run down. We were booked in a non-smoking room for 3 (3 single beds) but when we walked in the room it was apparent that regular smoking takes place in the room. You just have to open the window to see all the cigarette butts littered on the window ledge. The bed spreads were horrid, dirty and again, reeked of smoke. Luckily it was warm out the 2 days we were there, as we had to remove the bedspreads and blankets immediately and sleep with just sheets on the bed. Pillows were lumpy and old, the only saving grace is that the sheets were white and appeared clean. Bathroom was old and in poor condition. On the 2nd day we returned and found that the door had been left open (obviously by the cleaning service). When we called the front desk to let them know and to also ask them about the lack of non-smoking in the room - the response to the lack of security was mild concern at best and the non-smoking feedback was to angrily inform us that all of their rooms were non-smoking. Wireless is through T-Mobile. The gardens are overgrown and run down (but have so much potential - too bad). We had an early flight on our final day, so only had the breakfast the one morning which was good. For the price we were expecting much more but even with a rock bottom rate, we will not be returning to the Clarendon.

Reviews.Title: “Horrid”
Reviews.Author: MrLsWife
Reviews.Content: Arrived and found there was no parking spaces, most of onsite spaces were occupied by White vans and builders lorries. Parking in adjacent streets is free after 7pm however this meant hauling my suitcase for several minutes and leaving my car in a unsecured area - not ideal. The hotel is a rabbit warren of stairs and corridors so yet more struggling with bags and cases. Room was decorated in a 1980s style and had a very distinct smell..what this was I can't put my finger on but I was very worried that after a night in this room I would smell the same. This led me to check out the bathroom where I found no shower or shower attachment. Reception told me several rooms do not have showers or attachments and sent me up a plastic jug!!!! Perhaps I should have asked for a tin bath too! I was flabergasted.... I have never stayed in a hotel without a separate or over the bath shower, not to mention one without an attachment. Beyond poor .... Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, BUT ....................”
Reviews.Author: Seansaudi
Reviews.Content: I stayed here to attend a family occasion, and this was the nearest to the event. Great from the outside - but inside - think crossroads 30 years ago!!! Staff, mostly were not bothered, not attentive. Rooms are a fair size, but NO A/C and during the summer the room was like a sauna - way too hot - asked for a fan - they did not have them!!! There is one very small and very old fashioned lift - this is NOT a hotel if you have a suitcase for sure - as too many stairs, winding corridors - and no staff to help either. Breakfast, very poor - the hot options seem to have been sitting around for a long time. The plus side, great views over Blackheath and excellent location for the village, rail station and only 20 minutes to Trafalgar Square. Sadly that was its only good point. Value for money - well if they charged more i would be in touch with Trading standards.

Reviews.Title: “IDEAL STOP OVER HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Colly626
Reviews.Content: i found the staff polite and effiecient, room service quick and all staff friendly. enjoyed the full english breakfast. Ideal for the 02 as bus 108 stops outside the hotel. my only gripe would be that there was no air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and lovely location”
Reviews.Author: purplekitty64
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night as we were going to see Bon Jovi at the O2. Paid £100 for a superior double. Room was bigger than I expected and very clean. Bed was huge! Breakfast was excellent. We had the full english from the hot buffet and the food was freshly cooked. The bacon was very nice! Tea and coffee was served at your table in white china tea or coffee pots. The service in the dining room was excellent and everything was spotlessly clean (I've been to quite a few places where the cutlery and glasses were dirty). The hotel is in Blackheath Village and is ideal for the O2 as it is on a 24 hour bus route which takes about 15 mins to get to O2 and costs £2. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Update the decor and I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: purpleruby
Reviews.Content: The Clarendon is a good hotel. Its very convenient for the O2 which was the purpose of our trip. Get the 108 bus from Greenwich North tube station (stop B) and the hotel is about 5-7mins away. Check in was very quick and they accomodated us even though we turned up an hour early for check in. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. The room we stayed in was small even by London standards and the bathroom was tiny. However the room was spotless and the beds very comfortable. The decor is a little old fashoined for my taste and a few small touches here would make all the difference(such as duvets instead of blankets, matching curtains and bed speads etc). Even though the room is small a better use of the space and this wouldn't have been so much of an issue. Breakfast was wonderful, a hot buffet that wasn't dried out and actually tasted good is a mnor miracle! plenty of tea, coffee juice and everything needed (cups, cutlery) was in place when we needed it. Check out was smooth and again quick. Overall I was pleased with my stay here, if I was going to the O2 again would definately stay again but I wouldn't got out of my way to stay here if visiting London for another purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star by any stretch of the imagination”
Reviews.Author: yorkiepud
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short break in London which was let down by this very disappointing hotel. The location was excellent but the hotel was very sadly lacking in any comfort. We had booked in for two nights but I am sorry to say that one night was far too much and we couldn't bear to stay another. The decor was old fashioned and dated and the bathrooms were 'manky' with a very poor performing shower. We had chosen one of the better rooms as well. The food was appalling. Our evening meal was inedible and overcooked. The young girl who served us looked in need of a good wash and a good night's sleep. Bread rolls were charged at 95p each and had to be asked for. We were not the only ones complaining. We had high hopes for breakfast but how wrong was that. How hard can it be to make breakfast? Well, obviously too hard for this chef. It was totally dried up and overcooked. Yet again we left all our food. The staff couldn't have cared less. We really liked Blackheath and Greenwich and if you are visiting the Maritime museum or the Royal Observatory this hotel's location is spot on, also train's into central London, were easy and frequent. However, I would suggest you stay somewhere else. This hotel is not a 4 Star, it would struggle to make three stars in our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value and bad service”
Reviews.Author: poppyalan
Reviews.Content: I paid 150 pounds for a crown room and was expecting to arrive in London and stay in a beautiful english georgian hotel. What a disappointment! When I arrived at reception, the staff left me standing there for a few minutes without acknowleging me (they were busy talking about their personal lives). when they did assist me with check-in, this was done with no smile or warm welcome. When I asked questions they responded in thick london accents and grunted. My room was dated, dirty and scruffy. I had a terrible nights sleep as a party was happening and doors banged all night. The next morning there was vomit outside the maio entrance and many smokers. The breakfast was OK and the waiting staff attentive. For the price I was expecting much more and this hotel is not worth the money they charge and not upto the standard of a 150 pound per night hotel

Reviews.Title: “Not My Cup of Tea - Very Poor”
Reviews.Author: benbLondon
Reviews.Content: Went here for afternoon tea, and not impressed at all. Hotel is very tatty; torn, tired sofas in reception, with a huge coke-dispensing machine next to the reception desk. Staff at reception not welcoming. Told we could have the tea in the guests' lounge. Went there, empty, no lights on, facing the back of the hotel, partly underground, cold and depressing. Settled to have the tea - over £8 a head - near reception. Bread stale, only gave us one type of sandwich, instead of the two we were meant to get from the menu. Not impressed. Hotel's in good position on heath but needs a fortune spent on it to bring it up to standard, and proper staff training. Most of the guests we saw checking in seemed to be tradesmen working locally on jobs. I wouldn't stay here - the Novotel, close by in Greenwich, is far, far superior.

Reviews.Title: “Really not impressed - wish I'd read the reviews first!”
Reviews.Author: jamesandzo
Reviews.Content: Booked this as a last minute Valentine's break for my girlfriend, despite the fact that we don't live very far away... she loves Blackheath and grew up spending a lot of time in Greenwich, and I thought a room, four course meal, champagne and then a bucks fizz breakfast for £189 for two people would be good value. Don't get me wrong, the food was ok in the evening - very quickly served (yes, too quickly is possible!!) and the waiting staff didn't really seem to care. They were halfway attentive because every waiter asked if you wanted something because you didn't have one dedicated to serving you!! Bad points: - When we asked to move room, we were told "we'd have to take the champange and everything else with us as it won't be in the next room"... not exactly four star customer service - The new room was fine (i.e. not on the ground floor by the main road), until we realised we were opposite a very loud wedding party who enjoyed letting the old fashioned, heavy doors slam. All night... - We waited 45 mins for a mint tea on room service (and that was only because I called them again after half an hour) - TV reception was dodgy - Bathroom was old fashioned, small and cold. Couldn't get a shower in the morning as water was coming through but at best lukewarm out of the hot tap! - Quality of the breakfast was poor - had to queue for half an hour and then when we got there the range was pretty poor and even what they claimed to have they didn't (no sausages left, for example) On the plus side, we ordered a bottle of red with our dinner that they were clearly too disorganised to add to our bill and also the room service wasn't added. Not a great way to make money, is it? Also, we got a cab there. Parking is awful. All in all, not good value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, lovely building, Blackheath village on doorstep, super value.v”
Reviews.Author: timeismore
Reviews.Content: This is not an ultra modern, impersonal, expensive chain hotel. It is an older building that requires some updating - BUT it is charming and has lovely big rooms with crispy cotton sheets, windows that you can open (!) friendly bar and excellent restaurant. Moreover for its location to London and particularly Blackheath and Greenwich then it very good value for money. The staff recognise you when you return and they are loyal to the hotel - not just passing through.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and old”
Reviews.Author: kopel78
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a double bedroom, 100 pounds for a very very ugly room! The green carpet on the floor and the cheap furnitures in the room make you feel like you are on a boat. Totally overpriced even for the great location. Ok there is no other hotel around, it's clearly a monopoly, but if they don't do something about it they will finish like the Titanic!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: wifey01
Reviews.Content: First the not so good stuff. The hotel is in desperate need of a refurb, it's looking really tatty around the edges. The furniture is 'knocked' together, the carpets are worn, the sinks are tiny and the showers just about get you wet. We had a leak from the floor above, and looking at the mark on the carpet it wasn't the first time. However, the staff were great and within minutes we were moved to another room. These issues aside, the rooms and bathrooms are clean, although the bathrooms do show signs of long term wear too. The breakfast is good, but perhaps a bit repetative as we stayed for three nights. The great thing about this place is the location. It looks out over the common and on the other side is the Greenwich Observatory, and also the best view ever looking down on to the city. Blackheath station is two minutes away, and the trains are regular and it takes about 20 minutes to the city. In Blackheath there are a few pubs, and a few nice little bistro style restaurants and you really feel like you're in a large village. Would go again but after a refurb.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Mummabluberry
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of paying £120 for a Crown Room but I agree with most other reviews ....tired furnishings, in need of a refurb, shabby bathroom.... with just a trickle out of the shower. Most of all the TV was the size of a postage stamp but worse than that....it was an old flat screen placed high up on the wall that could only be viewed from a standing position directly in front of it . The bed was comfy though and we slept well but it appeared that everybody chose to turn up for breakfast at once because there was a long queue at 10 past 8 in the morning and there was insufficient room to seat everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value”
Reviews.Author: TravelerLAX
Reviews.Content: The problem with The Clarendon is this: if you are the kind of person who doesn't mind a hotel that is very simple, no frills, probably clean enough even though it doesn't look that clean because it's old and shabby, then you aren't the kind of person who wants to pay £99 - £200 for a room. Conversely, if you are are the kind of person willing to pay at least £99 - £200 for a room, then you expect a level of cleanliness and technology that comes along with that price. Our boiler died so we stayed in hotels for several days until it was fixed, as it was very cold and we had no heat or hot water. We stayed at the Le Méridien Piccadilly for £125 a night and it was clean, had a modern TV, a nice bar and restaurant and we were happy as could be. We stayed at The Clarendon for £26 less and the room was scummy with a 10" screen TV circa 1989 and a restaurant that I would think twice about before eating there. The Clarendon was not good value so beware.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, old-fashioned hotel...”
Reviews.Author: amber9999
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mate and really liked this hotel. It had an old-fashioned charm. Our room was spacious and we liked the hotel restaurant so much that we invited friends from Black Heath to dinner there. The location is great. Black Heath is right next to Greenwich where the observatory and other sites are. I liked most the sweeping view of the park-like area called the heath I think. We plan to return to this hotel on our next trip to London in summer, 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Wrong building for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: archaeocritic
Reviews.Content: It looks like it would be a good hotel but the layout and partitioning and the weak soundproofing really let it down. The rooms are spacious but the bed in our Crown Double was very uncomfortable and itchy as well. Also, they have a strange policy that will serve you a continental breakfast or anything from the room service menu in your room, but not the cooked breakfast. Overall, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel ideal for the o2 arena”
Reviews.Author: sofysmum
Reviews.Content: We were going to M Jacksons concert at the o2 arena but still decided to go London for a break, we liked the hotel,ideal for going to the o2 the 108 bus stop is just outside, our room was spacious with a large comfortable bed everything for an overnight stay, friendly and helpful staff especially Lorraine,plenty of places to eat in the village, our room overlooked the heath and it's a pleasant walk to Greenwich park, observatory, maritime museum & thames,. We give the thumbs up!Oh & the breakfast is good.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money and not up to standards”
Reviews.Author: The-mistery-guest
Reviews.Content: We had a room in the Heathview Wing, top floor. View was lovely all right. Pity that the windows were old and did not really muffle out the traffic noise, or even open easily. The heat in the room was almost unbearable. The floor of the room was not level, so that moving from the window to the bed, you actually walked downhill. Some of the furniture in the room (especially the cupboard) where askew too. On two occasions, the linen was ripped and with spots. Television was blurry, teapot filled with water from the previous guest (who knows for how long). The bathroom had pretty old fittings, with two separate taps for hot and cold. Not really up to today's standards. Showering was a challenge, since water pressure was quite low and temperature hard to set. One light bulb in bathroom was broken during our entire stay. The elevator is outdated and quite damaged. (Door is incredibly loud and the elevator ceiling is cracking.) General cleanlines in the hotel is below average. (Example: on the 2nd floor - elevator area, there were 2 used wine glasses left on the window sill. These glasses stayed there for 3 entire days!) Breakfast: Typical englisch breakfast. Quality was ok. Orange juice horrible. Waiting staff seemed a little confused.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it actually!”
Reviews.Author: simbasmum
Reviews.Content: Despite previous reviews, I really quite liked this hotel. The location in Blackheath was a pleasant surprise and on a sunny evening there was nowhere nicer to be than in my large room at the front of the hotel with the sun streaming in! Yes, there was traffic noise (I had to have the windows open as it was very warm), and yes, it is a bit creaky on the floors and along the corridors, and yes, you can hear noise from the corridors, but I felt the hotel had character and was very comfortable and good value for money. Blackheath village with all sorts of restaurants is a 3 minute walk, a lovely pub 1 minute to the right outside the hotel, and a green with duckpond etc., and all within 15/20 minutes travel of central London. I found it clean, staff were effficient (if not overly friendly) and had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Greatly in need of an update!!”
Reviews.Author: scotfin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Clarendon recently whilst attending a family occasion, In general the hotel was average, the room was a triple which had three single beds, we had booked am superior room with a double and a single, but this is what we got. The bathroom was something out of a time warp, tiny sink that you could hardly wash in, and very compact. The food was ok in the restaurant , although we did order sandwiches which took 40 minutes to come and when they did they were stale and inedible! The head receptionist was very frosty and rather unpleasant, and as for the duty manager that day , he was useless, we complained about the sandwiches and he didn't even give his apologies. The location in Blackheath is perfect, a lovely view across the heath, this is the best thing about the Clarendon Hotel, and no we won't stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but staff were rude!”
Reviews.Author: MindyFabs
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Clarendon after a long trans-Atlantic flight and a challenging journey from Heathrow to Blackheath, and did not find our welcome very warm. We had requested early check-in, but the woman at the front desk gave us a hard time about it initially (we were there at about 9am, and she immediately said "You'll have to come back at 2pm" when I said we had a reservation). The room was comfortable, although the decor could definitely use a 21st (or even late 20th) century update! We had no complaints about the room or the breakfast, which was plentiful and tasty. However, our major complaint about the hotel was the staff's complete disregard for the "Do Not Disturb" sign that we had on our door. After a late night out, we were sleeping in fairly late, and the housekeeper actually knocked on and then unlocked our door despite the sign's presence!! She quickly said sorry and scurried off after she realized we were there, but I thought that was absolutely unacceptable! That was the second time this had happened - the first time, we were just about to leave and asked her to please come back in five minutes, which she grudgingly agreed to. A further problem was that there was no concierge, and the front desk staff were either not very knowledgeable, or not interested in helping out a couple of tourists who'd never been to London before. We asked for advice on transit to get to downtown London, and it was only late in our stay that we realized there were several options available to us, not just the overground trains that the staff had told us to use. They also pointed us in the wrong direction when we asked which way to walk to Greenwich Village. Overall, the hotel itself and the breakfast were fine - everything was reasonably clean, in good working order, and comfortable. The staff, however, have a long way to go to live up to the standard of politeness that Britons have long held, and some more in-depth tourist information and assistance would have been very much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Big Let Down”
Reviews.Author: Alanmelon
Reviews.Content: Where to start?! From the outset, our experience of the Clarendon was not a good one. On arrival, the grossly inadequate car park was full to the brim. On asking door staff we were told "you can try the other car park round the back but that one's full too" leaving us to drive around for 10 minutes, eventually parking in a very exposed location and having to drag our luggage across to the hotel. Check in should have been straight forward, except that despite carefully booking on their own website, the reservation was under the wrong name. After following directions up and down staircases and through several doors, we arrived in a very outdated room with exposed pipework, and décor desperately in need of renovation. However, all appeared clean and tidy, so the room staff seemed to take pride in their job.
